title: Are smartphones the future of photography? - Quora

response.answer_text: As you asked so I shall answer and Yes of course they are as Smart Phones seem to be simply “Everything” for so many people and so why wouldn’t they be the best camera as well. People have stopped thinking and all we need to know is “How to ask Google” so when we are Lost “Ask Google” and the GPS will guide us so when we go shopping and cannot find that elusive product in the supermarket then ask Google because Google Knows. Because I live in a free country then I can decide what sort of camera that I want to play with and who knows as in a few short years I might be into some other sort of “Hobby” and not really into photography like I used to be. I might have taken up Art and be trying to paint with a brush and some canvas. Then I can ask Google how to mix paint er Hello Google like which colours do I mix to make brown.

While the smartphones have decent cameras they cannot replace a professional digital cameras features. No customer of mine would accept work done on my iPhone. I have used my phone as a notebook to record people or places for future reference but not final salable work. Photographic gear has been on a continuous improvement and changes since the 1850’s and will continue to be, so stand by and see.

For quick snaps on holiday, with friends, fine … ish. Don’t try to print larger than 10″ x 8″ without visible loss of quality. No commercial buyer of photography will consider a smartphone camera image as the sensor on a smart phone camera is very roughly 1/60 the size of the sensor on a DSLR, and the lens on a smartphone is substantially inferior to even a budget end DSLR lens. The daily repeat of this question……….. Smartphones are the present of photography - very useful for fun and some professional work, but they will due to physics never equal the best of camera (even though they have clear replaced point and shoot). I think the lack of swapable memory and batteries will also be another limitation that will be hard to overcome.

Not only the future this is the present of Photography. Street photographers, Reporters, Photojournalists often use a smartphone for their professional work where they can not take their bulky camera. Sometimes the smartphone will the job which a professional camera can not. Like legends say, “Gear does not matter, skill matters.”
Absolutely, Everyone is not a rich guy. Not everyone can afford the professional camera so,the smartphones are the future of photography.

They are already ,but once you get more into artistic or creative photography than flexibility to put your imagination exactly as you want a point and shoot, beginners or pro DSLR camera takes over and no limits to your creativity.
